content:
Hi there! The rustc-dev-guide currently says:

As of January 2021, work on explicitly parallelizing the
compiler has stalled. There is a lot of design and correctness work that needs
to be done.

and:

As of May 2020, much of this effort is on hold due to
lack of manpower. We have a working prototype with promising performance gains
in many cases. However, there are two blockers:

Is this still true?
(Please ping me if you respond since otherwise I may not see your message :smile:)
@Camelid I believe it's still true. I'd love to see someone revive this effort.
Is this tracking issue up to date?
Or do you mean nobody is working on compiler parallelization
So yes/no/don’t know on whether that tracking issue is up to date?

It is likely not, but I'm not sure that diving in is a good idea. The last work that went on in this area largely stalled out due to lack of bandwidth amongst the group -- and I'm pretty sure that bandwidth is still not present (even with one person being interested).
I do think there are others interested in diving in, though. @Timothy Maloney I'd be happy to connect you with some other folks who may care.
But yeah, expect very limited responses and review bandwidth.

@Josh Triplett Please do! I don’t mind waiting for responses/reviews. It will also give me extra time to figure things out for myself if I have a problem :)

I think first order of business then is try and bring that tracking issue up to date.
I was proposing @Timothy Maloney that it may be a good idea to document what they find to the Rustc Dev Guide #t-compiler/wg-rustc-dev-guide > document parallel rustc
maybe there are parallel rustc experts who are able to explain some things in general in a video call or something
